news.title: A Place of Asylum? National Renewal Depends on Breaking with Our Past
news.summary: The legacies of our past weigh heavily on us. Our attitudes toward asylum seekers - those who appear on the horizon, from over the seas, not-White in appearance and uninvited - have deep roots in our formative history as a nation.

news.title: Why Trump's wall with Mexico is so popular, and why it won't work
news.summary: Donald Trump tweeted on Jan. 6 that “any money spent on building the Great Wall (for the sake of speed), will be paid back by Mexico later.” The dishonest media does not report that any money spent on building the Great Wall (for sake of speed)…

news.title: Why Trump's wall with Mexico is so popular, and why it won't work
news.summary: Donald Trump tweeted on Jan. 6 that “any money spent on building the Great Wall (for the sake of speed), will be paid back by Mexico later.” The Economist reports that 40 countries have built fences since the fall of the Berlin Wall.

author.name: JASON
author.description: Making ME appear to be the enemy of my own race while YOU make yourself powerful by cozening to THEM is NO-GO. QUIT IT.
